text:
- [Narrator] The Seattle
Seahawks have a winning strategy

for remaining a top
performing team in the NFL.

- [Commentator] Wilson throws
for a Seahawks touchdown!
- [Narrator] But how they're staying ahead

in the world of data,
analytics and machine learning,
is what will continue to set them apart.
So how can businesses learn
from the Seahawks' winning strategy?

We sat down with Amazon
Web Services to find out.
(dynamic music)
- Being able to make data driven decisions
is imperative today.
It's the survival of the most informed,

where data spreading
faster than most companies
can keep track of.

Building a modern data
strategy that unifies

your data lakes, data virals,
and purposeful data stores,

and then adding analytics
and machine learning

is helping our customers
like the Seattle Seahawks
to keep a competitive edge.
The Seahawks use AWS to obtain insights

that help strengthen
their team and win games.
What if it were possible to aid coaches

in identifying targeted areas
for performance improvement?
Could data better motivate an athlete
to realize their potential?
- [Narrator] Such a scenario rose
from a newly recruited running back.
The coaches felt he was not exhibiting

the explosive movement that
he was known for when drafted.

Part of the persuasion
challenge was proving
there have been missed opportunities
to run through the hole.

The players and coaches
reviewed three weeks of data,
accounting for all of his handoffs,

and were able to pinpoint
specific opportunities he missed.

With that insight unveiled,
the player committed

to working a little harder on
those plays during practice

to see if that effort
translated into games.
- Several weeks later on game day,

the running back exploded
for 55 to 60 yards
to the end zone,
all starting from a data driven insight
that convinced him of the best way
he could improve his game during practice.

What if it were possible to
build such a collection of data

about an organization to
have a comprehensive profile
of its strengths and weaknesses,
so that stakeholders

could make informed
decisions on what investments
would translate into the greatest gains.
The Seahawks built a data lakes

combining NFL Next Gen
Stats player tracking

with realtime player
health and performance data

to evaluate the team's
strengths and weaknesses,

and use that to reinvent
the way they recruit.

- [Narrator] Scouting is
an exhaustive process.
It takes a lot of hours for the human eye

to consistently keep track
of where a potential recruit
is in the lineup,
the number of players they're in,
which players are om the field,
the formation, the spacing,

and whether the play
was properly executed.
The Seahawks use Amazon Recognition,

a deep learning image and
video analysis service
to account for these considerations.
This analysis, combined with
their comprehensive team profile,
is helping scouts identify particularly

well-fitting candidates that
would otherwise be missed.
- After re-imagining their approach,

the Seahawks coaching
staff has been able to

make more strategic decisions
about every game they play.

From how they match the
players up with the opponents,
to how design and execute specific plays.
All of that gives them a competitive edge,

and creates a cycle of
ongoing improvement.

Beyond sports, here are a
couple of other examples

of companies that are
making decisions based
on a winning data strategy.

Amazon uses data lakes
and machine learning

to forecast the appropriate
amount of demand
for each product,
determining how much product to purchase
and from what supplier,
place products close to the buyers,
and ensure that our systems predict
accurate product delivery times.
Carrier, the global leader of healthy,

safe, sustainable, and
intelligent building
and cold chain solutions,

developed a system to give
the company a 360 degree view
of its spend profile,
and then used AI and machine learning
to unlock insights from that data
to achieve efficiency improvements.

Phillips, a global leader
in healthcare technology,
developed HealthSuite,

a secure and healthcare
compliant digital cloud platform
that helps manage an increasingly complex
digital enrollment of data,

reaching from hospital to the
home, to improve efficiency,

and transform patient
and provider experiences.
We are always improving, always learning,
and our technology is learning with us.
This is going to change everything
about what we do for the better.
There are so many new innovations
that are going to be possible.
That's what drives our team.
(calm music)
